semcol

;:, semcol, [%smcl p=twig q=tusk] is a synthetic hoon that applies p, a binary gate, to the n-ary tuple q.

Definition

++  twig  
  $%  [%smcl p=twig q=tusk]
  ==
++  tusk  (list twig)

Regular form (tall)

;:  p
  i.q
  i.t.q
  i.t.t.q
==

Regular form (wide)

;:(p i.q i.t.q i.t.t.q)

Irregular form

:(p i.q i.t.q i.t.t.q)

Expansion

++  open
  ^-  twig
  ?-    gen
      [%smcl *]
    ?-    q.gen
        ~       [%zpzp ~]
        [* ~]   i.q.gen
        ^
      :+  %tsls
        p.gen
      =+  yex=`(list twig)`q.gen
      |-  ^-  twig
      ?-  yex
        [* ~]  [%tsgr [~ 3] i.yex]
        [* ^]  [%cnhp [~ 2] [%tsgr [~ 3] i.yex] $(yex t.yex) ~]
        ~      !!
      ==
    ==
  ==

Notes

It's certainly nice to be able to say :(add 2 3 4) and get 9.
